ipi-bfd:bfd.description: Structural container for Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD).

notification-enabled.description: Use this attribute to enable or disable BFD SNMP notification.

echo-mode-enabled.description: This leaf exists when echo mode is running between the local and remote system. When it does not exist, solely asynchronous mode is active.

slow-tx-interval.description: Use this command to set a BFD slow timer interval.

state.description: Operational state parameters for BFD.

notification-enabled.description: Use this attribute to enable or disable BFD SNMP notification.

echo-mode-enabled.description: This leaf exists when echo mode is running between the local and remote system. When it does not exist, solely asynchronous mode is active.

slow-tx-interval.description: Use this command to set a BFD slow timer interval.

start-time.description: The date and time at which BFD process started, expressed as the number of seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1, 1970, 00:00 UTC).

administrative-state.description: The administrative state of the BFD process on local system.

image-type.description: Monolitc or distributed BFD image type.

next-session-discriminator.description: Local discriminator to be used in the next BFD session.

desired-minimum-tx-interval.description: The minimum interval between transmission of BFD control packets that the operator desires. This value is advertised to the peer, however the actual interval used is specified by taking the maximum of desired-minimum-tx-interval and the value of the remote required-minimum-receive interval value.

required-minimum-rx-interval.description: The minimum interval between received BFD control packets that this system should support. This value is advertised to the remote peer to indicate the maximum frequency (i.e., minimum inter-packet interval) between BFD control packets that is acceptable to the local system.

detection-multiplier.description: The number of packets that must be missed to declare this session as down. The detection interval for the BFD session is calculated by multiplying the value of the negotiated transmission interval by this value.

desired-minimum-tx-interval.description: The minimum interval between transmission of BFD control packets that the operator desires. This value is advertised to the peer, however the actual interval used is specified by taking the maximum of desired-minimum-tx-interval and the value of the remote required-minimum-receive interval value.

required-minimum-rx-interval.description: The minimum interval between received BFD control packets that this system should support. This value is advertised to the remote peer to indicate the maximum frequency (i.e., minimum inter-packet interval) between BFD control packets that is acceptable to the local system.

detection-multiplier.description: The number of packets that must be missed to declare this session as down. The detection interval for the BFD session is calculated by multiplying the value of the negotiated transmission interval by this value.

state.description: Operational state parameters for BFD multihop peer

detection-multiplier.description: The number of packets that must be missed to declare this session as down. The detection interval for the BFD session is calculated by multiplying the value of the negotiated transmission interval by this value.

config.description: Configuration parameters for Generalized TTL Security Mechanism.

generalized-ttl-security-mechanism-enabl.description: Use this attribute to enable or disable Generalized TTL Security Mechanism.

ttl.description: Use this attribute to set Time To Live value for Generalized TTL Security Mechanism.

state.description: Operational state parameters for Generalized TTL Security Mechanism.

generalized-ttl-security-mechanism-enabl.description: Use this attribute to enable or disable Generalized TTL Security Mechanism.

ttl.description: Use this attribute to set Time To Live value for Generalized TTL Security Mechanism.

remote-address.description: The IP address used by the remote system for BFD session.
The IP address used by the remote system for BFD session.

key-id.description: Use this attribute to specify a key-id for the authentication

key-encrypted.description: Use this attribute to configure the authentication key to specify if the key-string is to be encrypted or not.

key-string.description: Use this attribute to specify the key authentication string

key-chain.description: Use this attribute to specify an key-chain name that is already configured.

key-type.description: Use this attribute to specify the authentication type for BFD sessions. There are five types of authentication: simple (simple password), keyed-md5 (keyed message digest), meticulous-keyed-md5 (meticulous keyed message digest), keyed-sha1 (keyed secure hashing algorithm), meticulous-keyed-sha1 (meticulous keyed secure hashing algorithm).

options.description: Use this attribute to debug the oamd process.

enable-oam-srv6.description: Use this attribute to debug OAM SRV6

bfd-disabled.description: Use this attribute to enable or disable all the BFD sessions on this interface.

bfd-session-type.description: Use this attribute to offload Single HOP BFD sessions to software or hardware.

required-minimum-tx-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure BFD echo packet transmission interval, in milliseconds

sessions.description: Set BFD sessions on this interface

session.description: BFD session table for runtime attrs

local-address.description: BFD ip user intf src related configs

remote-address.description: BFD ip user intf dest related configs

local-address.description: BFD ip user intf src related configs

remote-address.description: BFD ip user intf dest related configs

state.description: BFD session state

local-address.description: BFD ip user intf src related configs

remote-address.description: BFD ip user intf dest related configs

local-discriminator.description: A unique identifier used by the local system to identify this BFD session

state.description: BFD session state

ipv4.description: BFD session ipv4 packets counters state

received.description: Number of packets that have been received during this BFD session

transmitted.description: Number of packets that have been transmitted during this BFD session

echo-transmitted.description: Number of Echo-packets that have been transmitted during this BFD session

ipv6.description: BFD session IPv6 packets counters state

received.description: Number of packets that have been received during this BFD session

transmitted.description: Number of packets that have been transmitted during this BFD session

echo-transmitted.description: Number of Echo-packets that have been transmitted during this BFD session

up-transitions.description: Number of times the BFD session has been up

lower-layer-type.description: The lower layer protocol on which BFD is carried

uptime.description: Length of time this BFD session has been up

local-port.description: UDP port number of the transmitting device

remote-heard.description: Indication that a BFD control packet has been received from remote peer

fate-shared.description: Indication that a failure in this BFD session cannot be disentangled from other events taking place in the control plane

remote-administrative-down.description: This leaf is set to true when the remote system is administratively down

remote-demand-mode-enabled.description: This leaf is set to true when the remote system has requested demand mode be run for this session

remote-echo-enabled.description: This leaf is set to true when the remote system is operating in echo mode

downtime.description: Amount of time that this BFD session is in down state

discontinuity-time.description: Time when counters met with discontinuity

authentication-key-id.description: identifier number of the authentication key specified for this BFD session

last-up-time.description: The time of the last transition of the BFD session to UP state, expressed as the number of seconds since the Unix epoch

hold-down-timer.description: Time for holding the session before deleting it

hold-down-timer-hits.description: Elapsed time for holding the session before deleting it

remote-address.description: The IP address used by the remote system for this BFD session

local-address.description: The IP address used by the local system for this BFD session

interface-index.description: Interface index associated with this BFD session

interface-name.description: Interface name associated with this BFD session

remote-discriminator.description: A unique identified used by the remote system to identify this BFD session

local-discriminator.description: A unique identifier used by the local system to identify this BFD session

session-state.description: The state of the BFD session perceived by the local system

session-type.description: Session type configured for this BFD session

session-diagnostics.description: The local BFD diagnostic code indicating the most recent reason for failure of this BFD session

micro-bfd-sessions.description: Include per-member link BFD only when the type of interface is a link    aggregate

interface.description: This list contains configuration and state parameters relating to      micro-BFD session

member-interface.description: Reference to a member link of the aggregate interface being described

state.description: Operational state parameters for the micro-BFD session

member-interface.description: Reference to a member link of the aggregate interface being described

remote-session-state.description: The reported state of the BFD session according to the remote system. This state reflects the last state reported in a BFD control packet

remote-session-diagnostics.description: The remote BFD diagnostic code indicating the remote system's reason for failure of the BFD session

interface-index.description: Interface index associated with this BFD session

interface-name.description: Interface name associated with this BFD session

local-discriminator.description: A unique identifier used by the local system to identify this BFD session

session-state.description: The state of the BFD session perceived by the local system

session-type.description: Session type configured for this BFD session

session-diagnostics.description: The local BFD diagnostic code indicating the most recent reason for failure of this BFD session

state.description: BFD session echo state

local-echo-port.description: Echo UDP port number of the transmitting device

state.description: BFD session MPLS state

virtual-circuit-connectivity-verificatio.description: Virtual Circuit Connectivity Verification for BFD MPLS session

transport-profile.description: Transport profile for BFD MPLS session

packet-version.description: Session version number of the remote system

packet-desired-minimum-tx-interval.description: Minimum echo transmit interval of the remote system

packet-required-minimum-rx-interval.description: Minimum receive interval of the remote system

required-minimum-echo-rx-interval.description: Minimum receive interval capacity of the remote system

index.description: Session index, usually the local discriminator

state.description: client for BFD session state

flags.description: Flags for internal BFD client module
